trans-unit.source: Setting Properties and Metadata during the Import Process
trans-unit.target: Setting Properties and Metadata during the Import Process

trans-unit.source: When you run the Microsoft Azure Import/Export tool to prepare your drives, you can specify properties and metadata to be set on the destination blobs.
trans-unit.target: When you run the Microsoft Azure Import/Export tool to prepare your drives, you can specify properties and metadata to be set on the destination blobs.

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps:
trans-unit.target: Follow these steps:

trans-unit.source: To set blob properties, create a text file on your local computer that specifies property names and values.
trans-unit.target: To set blob properties, create a text file on your local computer that specifies property names and values.

trans-unit.source: To set blob metadata, create a text file on your local computer that specifies metadata names and values.
trans-unit.target: To set blob metadata, create a text file on your local computer that specifies metadata names and values.

trans-unit.source: Pass the full path to one or both of these files to the Azure Import/Export tool as part of the <languageKeyword>PrepImport</languageKeyword> operation.
trans-unit.target: Pass the full path to one or both of these files to the Azure Import/Export tool as part of the <languageKeyword>PrepImport</languageKeyword> operation.

trans-unit.source: When you specify a properties or metadata file as part of a copy session, those properties or metadata are set for every blob that is imported as part of that copy session.
trans-unit.target: When you specify a properties or metadata file as part of a copy session, those properties or metadata are set for every blob that is imported as part of that copy session.

trans-unit.source: If you want to specify a different set of properties or metadata for some of the blobs being imported, you'll need to create a separate copy session with different properties or metadata files.
trans-unit.target: If you want to specify a different set of properties or metadata for some of the blobs being imported, you'll need to create a separate copy session with different properties or metadata files.

trans-unit.source: Specify Blob Properties in a Text File
trans-unit.target: Specify Blob Properties in a Text File

trans-unit.source: To specify blob properties, create a local text file, and include XML that specifies property names as elements, and property values as values.
trans-unit.target: To specify blob properties, create a local text file, and include XML that specifies property names as elements, and property values as values.

trans-unit.source: Here's an example that specifies some property values:
trans-unit.target: Here's an example that specifies some property values:

trans-unit.source: Save the file to a local location like <codeInline>C:\WAImportExport\ImportProperties.txt</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Save the file to a local location like <codeInline>C:\WAImportExport\ImportProperties.txt</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Specify Blob Metadata in a Text File
trans-unit.target: Specify Blob Metadata in a Text File

trans-unit.source: Similarly, to specify blob metadata, create a local text file that specifies metadata names as elements, and metadata values as values.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, to specify blob metadata, create a local text file that specifies metadata names as elements, and metadata values as values.

trans-unit.source: Here's an example that specifies some metadata values:
trans-unit.target: Here's an example that specifies some metadata values:

trans-unit.source: Save the file to a local location like <codeInline>C:\WAImportExport\ImportMetadata.txt</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Save the file to a local location like <codeInline>C:\WAImportExport\ImportMetadata.txt</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Create a Copy Session Including the Properties or Metadata Files
trans-unit.target: Create a Copy Session Including the Properties or Metadata Files

trans-unit.source: When you run the Azure Import/Export tool to prepare the import job, specify the properties file on the command line using the <codeInline>PropertyFile</codeInline> parameter.
trans-unit.target: When you run the Azure Import/Export tool to prepare the import job, specify the properties file on the command line using the <codeInline>PropertyFile</codeInline> parameter.

trans-unit.source: Specify the metadata file on the command line using the <codeInline>/MetadataFile</codeInline> parameter.
trans-unit.target: Specify the metadata file on the command line using the <codeInline>/MetadataFile</codeInline> parameter.

trans-unit.source: Here's an example that specifies both files:
trans-unit.target: Here's an example that specifies both files:
